intro: Lippia volkii, commonly known as Volk's verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Lippia volkii is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
